input.rev_rec_notes: Committed host subscriptions recognized ratably over term. Usage/overages (host-hours, APM spans, logs) recognized as consumption occurs. Month-7 upgrade is a contract modification adding 200 more Infra hosts plus APM + Logs - may require reallocation depending on treatment.
input.use_case_description: Customer signs a 12-month observability agreement anchored on Infrastructure Monitoring (Enterprise) with a committed baseline of 500 hosts at $23/host/month (list), billed monthly in advance but committed for the full annual term. The Infra rate plan also includes a separate usage/overage charge for any host-hours above the 500-host commitment, priced at the on-demand equivalent of $27/host/month (modeled as a usage charge rated monthly from host-hour consumption). Starting in month 7 (a mid-term upgrade / contract modification), the customer adds 200 more committed Infra hosts (bringing the baseline to 700) and also adds APM at 150 APM hosts at $31/APM host/month (list), billed monthly for the remainder of the term with proration from the effective date. APM also includes monthly usage overages billed in arrears: $1.70 per million indexed spans and $0.10 per GB ingested spans beyond included allotments (modeled as separate usage charges). In the same month-7 upgrade, the customer adds Log Management usage charges for ongoing consumption billed monthly in arrears: Log Ingest at $0.10/GB and Standard Indexing at $1.70 per million events (billed-annually rates used as list for the demo). Commercially, the seller applies a 12% bundle discount to the fixed recurring components (Infra committed hosts + APM host subscription) starting at the upgrade effective date; usage overages remain undiscounted and bill at list. Revenue expectation (inferred): fixed SaaS subscription components recognized ratably over the service period; usage/overage charges recognized as consumption occurs; the mid-term upgrade is treated as a contract modification that may require reallocation across remaining performance obligations depending on SSP and modification treatment.

hints: “12-month … agreement” and per-host / per-APM-host monthly pricing → RECURRING
“billed monthly in advance” for committed baseline → supports recurring billing pattern (billing_timing captured as InAdvance)
“committed baseline of 500 hosts … committed for the full annual term” → MIN COMMIT
“usage/overage … above the 500-host commitment … modeled as a usage charge” and “usage overages billed in arrears” → USAGE + OVERAGE
“Starting in month 7 (a mid-term upgrade / contract modification)” adding quantities/products → AMENDMENT and Revenue CONTRACT MOD
“12% bundle discount to the fixed recurring components … usage overages remain undiscounted” → DISCOUNT (on recurring only)
“may require reallocation … depending on SSP and modification treatment” → Revenue ALLOCATION

subscription.name: Datadog - Observability Agreement (Infra + Upgrade w/ APM + Logs) - 2026

charges.name: Infra Committed Hosts - Months 7-12 (700 @ $23 list, 12% disc)

assumptions: Term end date assumed as 2027-01-01 (i.e., 12 months from 2026-01-01). For ratable recognition windows, end is treated as 2026-12-31.
Month-7 upgrade effective date assumed to be 2026-07-01 (start of month 7) to align with monthly billing periods; proration is therefore minimal/none in this design.
The 12% bundle discount is modeled directly via sellPrice on the fixed recurring components starting 2026-07-01; usage charges remain at list price (undiscounted).
Infra host-hour overage rate assumes 720 host-hours per month (30 days * 24 hours) to convert $27/host/month into $0.0375/host-hour for demo purposes.
Usage charges are configured as billed monthly in arrears and recognized upon consumption events (usage import / consumption event).
Included usage allotments (if any) for APM/logs are not modeled; only overage usage charges are represented.
Allocations are expected to be performed in ZR using list price as SSP, primarily across the fixed recurring components (Infra committed + APM hosts), especially at the month-7 contract modification.
open_questions: Confirm the intended subscription end date handling: should the 12-month term end on 2026-12-31 (inclusive) or 2027-01-01 (exclusive/end date)?
For Infra committed hosts after the upgrade, does the 12% discount apply to the entire 700-host baseline (including the original 500) or only to the incremental 200 and the new APM subscription?
Should Infra host-hour overages be billed strictly in arrears (typical for usage) or can they be billed in advance/estimated then trued up?
For revenue, confirm modification treatment in ZR: prospective, retrospective (cumulative catch-up), or separate contract; this affects whether/how reallocation is performed over the remaining term.
Do APM/logs usage charges require invoice-based recognition instead of consumption-event recognition (i.e., use BL-PIT-CONSUMP-PAYGO)?

charge_pob_map.rationale: Fixed stand-ready SaaS service; recognize ratably over the service period based on booking release.

alternatives.why_not: Would defer release until billing; the stated expectation is ratable over service with allocations based on contract/booking.

charge_pob_map.chargeName: Infra Committed Hosts - Months 7-12 (700 @ $23 list, 12% disc)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Contract modification segment (price/qty change on same stand-ready service); recognize ratably over remaining service period.

alternatives.why_not: If policy requires release only as billed; not aligned to stated booking-based ratable expectation.

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Usage / Overage - Recognize Upon Consumption (Usage Event)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Variable consideration tied to actual host-hour consumption; recognize as the usage occurs.

alternatives.why_not: Use only if revenue policy recognizes usage when billed rather than when consumed.

alternatives.pob_name: Usage - Recognize by Usage Quantity Event
alternatives.why_not: Could be used if your integration posts USAGE_QTY events (not 'Upon Consumption') and you want that event type specifically.

charge_pob_map.rationale: Fixed stand-ready SaaS service added mid-term; recognize ratably over remaining service period (subject to contract modification allocation).

alternatives.why_not: Only if your accounting requires billing-based release for monthly in-advance invoices.

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Usage / Overage - Recognize Upon Consumption (Usage Event)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Variable consideration based on actual spans indexed; recognize as consumption occurs.

alternatives.why_not: Use only if you recognize usage when invoiced (monthly in arrears) instead of when consumed.

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Usage / Overage - Recognize Upon Consumption (Usage Event)
charge_pob_map.rationale: Variable consideration based on actual GB ingested; recognize as consumption occurs.

alternatives.why_not: Use only if policy is invoice-based recognition for usage.

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Usage - Logs Ingest - Recognize Upon Consumption
charge_pob_map.rationale: Pure consumption-based logs ingest; revenue recognized as usage occurs (not ratable).

alternatives.why_not: Only if logs usage should be recognized upon billing rather than upon consumption events.

charge_pob_map.pob_name: Usage - Logs Indexing - Recognize Upon Consumption
charge_pob_map.rationale: Consumption-based indexing; recognize revenue as events are processed/consumed.

alternatives.why_not: Only if your accounting policy recognizes usage when invoiced (monthly in arrears).

mapping_notes: Fixed recurring SaaS components are mapped to BK-OT-RATABLE to support ratable recognition over service and compatibility with list-price-based SSP allocation in ZR.
Usage/overage components are mapped to EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-USAGE to recognize as consumption occurs; ensure your integration posts the appropriate consumption/usage events to ZR for timely release.
The month-7 upgrade is modeled via charge segmentation and new mid-term charges; this supports contract-modification allocation/reallocation over the remaining service period when enabled in ZR.

If operationally you prefer invoice-driven recognition for usage (common when consumption events are not available), switch usage mappings to BL-PIT-CONSUMP-PAYGO and align the revenue expectation accordingly.

assumptions: Upgrade (month-7) effective date is assumed to be 2026-07-01 (start of the 7th monthly period), so no mid-month proration is applied.
Billing periods are aligned to calendar months; Billing Period End is shown as the last calendar day of the month (for readability).
Billing Timing handling: Monthly InAdvance recurring charges bill on the period start date; Monthly InArrears usage charges bill on the period end date.
12% bundle discount is applied only to fixed recurring components starting 2026-07-01 (Infra committed hosts and APM host subscription). Usage/overage charges remain undiscounted at list.
Usage charges are included as billing events with Quantity=0 and Amount=0 as placeholders because no consumption inputs (host-hours, spans, GB, events) were provided.
Infra overage is modeled as a host-hour usage rate converted from $27/host-month using a standard 730 hours/month, resulting in $0.03698630 per host-hour.
open_questions: Confirm the contract modification / upgrade effective date. If it is not exactly 2026-07-01 (e.g., mid-month), the recurring charges for July 2026 should be prorated accordingly.
Confirm the intended unit of measure for Infra overage (host-hour vs host-month) and the conversion convention (actual hours in month vs fixed 730) used for rating.

Provide included allotments (and actual monthly consumption) for APM Indexed Spans, APM Ingested Spans, Log Ingest (GB), and Log Indexing (million events) to calculate usage/overage quantities and amounts.

Confirm whether your invoicing process dates in-arrears invoices on the period end date (e.g., 2026-07-31) or on the following day / next period start (e.g., 2026-08-01) based on your Zuora bill run schedule configuration.

zr_contracts_orders.Subscription Name: Datadog - Observability Agreement (Infra + Upgrade w/ APM + Logs) - 2026

assumptions: For recurring committed-host charges, Ordered Qty is modeled as host-months (hosts × number of service months in the POB service period) so that Ext List/Sell/SSP reflect total contract value for that service period.
Allocation is performed using List Price as SSP for allocation-eligible recurring POBs only; usage/overage POBs are excluded from allocation (Allocation Eligible Flag = false).

The month-7 upgrade is modeled as a contract modification / amendment with Subscription Version = 2 and Sales Order Date = 2026-07-01; allocation is applied within that amendment’s fixed recurring components (Infra months 7-12 and APM months 7-12).

The 12% bundle discount is applied only to fixed recurring components starting 2026-07-01; usage charges remain at list (and have $0 booking amounts in this Contracts/Orders table until consumption is reported).
All currency amounts are in USD; money fields are effectively treated as 2-decimal values (even where shown as whole numbers).

Usage charge lines are included for completeness with $0 quantities/amounts at booking because expected consumption was not provided; revenue for these POBs is assumed to be recognized upon consumption as usage is uploaded and priced.
For 'ongoing' usage periods, Revenue End Date is set to the contract term end date 2026-12-31 for the purposes of this table.
open_questions: Contract modification treatment: should the month-7 upgrade be treated prospectively (allocate only new/remaining POBs) or retrospectively (reallocate from inception / adjust prior allocations)?

Infra baseline modeling: do you intend months 7-12 to represent the full committed baseline of 700 hosts, or should it be modeled as (a) continuation of 500 hosts plus (b) an incremental 200-host add-on line?

Should any usage/overage expected value (estimate) be included in transaction price at booking (variable consideration subject to constraint), or should all usage remain excluded until billed/consumed?
Do APM spans and Logs indexing/ingest include any bundled allotments that would change when/what is considered 'overage' and therefore impact expected usage billings?

assumptions: Daily straight-line recognition uses an inclusive day count (Revenue Start Date and Revenue End Date both included).
Monthly amounts are based on the number of service days that fall within each calendar month in the recognition window.
Amounts are rounded to 2 decimals per month; the final month in each ratable line is trued-up to ensure the sum of period Amounts equals Ext Allocated Price exactly.
For EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-USAGE (event-driven usage) lines, no usage/consumption events were provided, so all periods are shown as $0 per instructions.
open_questions: For Line 2 (Infra Host-Hour Overage), please provide the 2026 monthly usage/consumption quantities (or dated usage events) and the applicable unit rate (or prepaid pool rate) so revenue can be recognized 'Upon Consumption'.

For Lines 5-8 (APM/Logs overages), please provide monthly consumption quantities for Jul-2026 through Dec-2026 (or dated usage events) and the applicable unit rates (or prepaid pool rates) to calculate event-driven revenue recognition.

assumptions: Contract term is 12 months starting 2026-01-01; term end is treated as 2026-12-31 for recognition windows (with an administrative end date of 2027-01-01 used in some subscription constructs).
Month-7 upgrade / contract modification is effective 2026-07-01 (aligned to a billing period boundary), so no mid-month proration is modeled.

Billing calendar is aligned to calendar months; recurring committed components are billed monthly in advance on the period start date; usage/overage is billed monthly in arrears on the period end date.

Infrastructure Monitoring committed baseline is 500 hosts for months 1–6 at $23/host/month list, and the post-upgrade baseline is assumed to be 700 hosts for months 7–12 (unless modeled as separate 500 + 200 lines).
APM committed subscription is added effective 2026-07-01 for the remainder of the term: 150 APM hosts at $31/APM host/month list; billed monthly for months 7–12.

A 12% bundle discount is applied only to fixed recurring subscription components (Infra committed hosts + APM host subscription) starting 2026-07-01; all usage/overage charges remain undiscounted at list.
All currency amounts are in USD; monetary fields are treated as 2-decimal precision, with rounding managed at the schedule level.

Usage/overage components (Infra host-hours, APM spans, logs ingest/indexing) are modeled as consumption-based charges billed in arrears; revenue is assumed to be recognized upon consumption events (usage import / consumption events) when available.
Included usage allotments (if any) for APM and Logs are not modeled; only overage usage charges are represented.
No usage quantities were provided; therefore usage billing events and event-driven revenue schedules are shown as placeholders with zero quantity and zero amount until consumption is supplied.

Infrastructure overage pricing is modeled as on-demand equivalent of $27/host/month converted to a host-hour rate using a fixed hours-per-month convention for demo purposes (noting two conventions appeared in the pipeline: 720 vs 730 hours/month).

Performance obligation mapping assumes fixed recurring SaaS components are ratable over the service period (e.g., mapped to a ratable POB such as BK-OT-RATABLE), while usage/overage components are consumption/event-driven (e.g., mapped to an event-driven POB such as EVT-PIT-CONSUMP-USAGE).

Revenue allocation assumption: allocation is performed in Zuora Revenue using list price as SSP for allocation-eligible fixed recurring POBs; usage/overage POBs are excluded from allocation (allocation eligible flag set to false).

Contract modification is implemented via segmentation/new mid-term charges (Subscription Version = 2, Sales Order Date = 2026-07-01), enabling reallocation across remaining fixed recurring performance obligations depending on Zuora Revenue modification settings.

For Contracts/Orders modeling, ordered quantities for recurring committed-host charges are represented as host-months across the applicable service months so extended list/sell/SSP represent the total transaction price for that service period.
For reporting convenience in the tables, ongoing usage POB revenue windows are set through the contract term end date (2026-12-31), even though actual recognition is driven by consumption timing.

Ratable recognition uses daily straight-line with inclusive day counts; monthly amounts are derived from service days in each month, rounded to 2 decimals, with a final-period true-up to match the allocated amount exactly.

If operational constraints prevent consumption-event recognition, an alternate assumption is that usage revenue could be recognized from billing/invoices (switch mapping to an invoice-driven paygo POB such as BL-PIT-CONSUMP-PAYGO), with the revenue expectation adjusted accordingly.
open_questions: [BLOCKING] What is the definitive contract end-date convention for the 12-month term: end on 2026-12-31 (inclusive) vs 2027-01-01 (exclusive/end date)? (Affects billing periods, recognition windows, and day counts.)

[BLOCKING] What revenue modification treatment should be applied in Zuora Revenue for the 2026-07-01 upgrade: prospective, retrospective/cumulative catch-up, or treat as a separate contract? (Directly affects whether/how reallocation and catch-up entries occur.)

[BLOCKING] Does the 12% bundle discount starting 2026-07-01 apply to (a) the entire post-upgrade fixed recurring baseline (all 700 Infra hosts + APM hosts) or (b) only the incremental adds (200 Infra + new APM)? (Affects transaction price, allocation, and revenue.)

[HIGH] How should the Infra committed baseline be represented for months 7–12: a single 700-host recurring line, or two lines (continuation of 500 + incremental 200)? (Affects amendment structure, allocation pools, and reporting.)

[HIGH] For usage revenue recognition, do you require consumption/event-driven recognition (usage events) or invoice-driven recognition for APM/Logs/Infra overages? (Determines POB mapping and integration requirements.)

[HIGH] Should any expected/estimated usage (variable consideration) be included in the transaction price at booking (subject to constraint), or should all usage remain excluded until billed/consumed? (Affects allocation and revenue timing.)

[HIGH] Confirm Infra overage rating details: unit of measure (host-hour vs host-month), whether strictly billed in arrears, and the hours-per-month conversion convention (actual hours by month vs fixed 720/730). (Affects invoicing accuracy and usage revenue amounts.)

[HIGH] Were there any included/bundled allotments for APM indexed spans, APM ingested spans, log ingest (GB), and log indexing (million events) that define what qualifies as “overage”? (Affects usage charge quantities and customer invoicing.)

[HIGH] Provide actual consumption inputs (or dated usage events) for Infra overage host-hours and APM/Logs usage metrics for Jul–Dec 2026 (and earlier months for Infra overage if applicable). (Required to compute usage billings and event-driven revenue schedules.)

[MEDIUM] Confirm the actual upgrade effective date/time. If not exactly 2026-07-01 (e.g., mid-month), should July 2026 recurring charges be prorated, and what proration policy applies? (Affects July billing and revenue schedules.)

[MEDIUM] For in-arrears invoicing, do invoices date on the service period end date (e.g., 2026-07-31) or the next day/next period start (e.g., 2026-08-01) based on your Zuora bill run schedule? (Affects invoice dating, accounting period cutoffs, and revenue/billing alignment.)
